name: Martina Groesbeck

topics.response_text: Thank you! They were going to kill me!

topics.topic_text: You were lucky. I might not be around next time.
topics.response_text: There won't be a next time. I hope.

topics.topic_text: Why were the Omertas out to kill you?
topics.response_text: I... may have overheard some things at Gomorrah that I passed on to the NCR. That's all! Honest.

topics.topic_text: Save your thanks - this was a job, nothing more.
You work with the NCR? It was the Legion who sent me to protect you.
topics.response_text: {slightly insulted}What? I only talk to Captain Curtis over at McCarran. I would never work with slavers. Honest.
No! Well, not really. I mean, I'm not listening through doors or sneaking around or anything. People talk out loud, and I just pay attention.
It isn't normally. The NCR wanted me to just gamble and listen, nothing else.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about something else now.
What do you do around here?
topics.response_text: I do odd jobs here and there, usually helping Sarah keep the Vault tidy. I came to New Vegas to be a professional gambler.

description:
Martina Groesbeck is a 28 year-old African American Female.

Martina Groesbeck is an African American woman in her late 20s, living in Vault 21 on the New Vegas strip. Once aspiring to be a professional gambler, she now works odd jobs while secretly serving as an informant for Captain Ronald Curtis, unknowingly gathering intelligence for Caesar's Legion.

Martina Groesbeck's Personality: Martina is resourceful and pragmatic, having adapted to the harsh realities of life on the New Vegas strip. She maintains a friendly exterior but is cautious and calculating, always looking for opportunities to improve her situation. Despite her setbacks, she hasn't lost her hope for a better future.

Martina Groesbeck's Backstory: Martina came to New Vegas with dreams of striking it rich as a professional gambler, but luck wasn't on her side. After losing most of her money, she was forced to take odd jobs to survive. She now primarily works for Sarah Weintraub, helping maintain Vault 21 in exchange for shelter and a small income. However, her most significant role is serving as an informant for Captain Ronald Curtis. She frequents the casinos, gathering information under the guise of gambling, unaware that the intelligence she's providing is ultimately benefiting Caesar's Legion.
